title.narrative: 17 CMAM:04 NUTRITION

description.narrative: By 2017 Community management of acute malnutrition programme and nutrition sensitive interventions scaled-up in priority States and the prevalence of wasting (GAM) among children under-five years (both girls and boys) reduced to less than 5 percent, which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, the nutritional status of Infants, young children and women is improved through the scale-up of integrated high impact and evidence-based nutrition interventions and improved family and community care practices with a focus on those most vulnerable.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017 Community management of acute malnutrition programme and nutrition sensitive interventions scaled-up in priority States and the prevalence of wasting (GAM) among children under-five years (both girls and boys) reduced to less than 5 percent

description.narrative: UNICEF rolled out community-based treatment of acute malnutrition in 12 northern states; treated 1.72 million children, translating into saving over 300 thousand lives of children between 2014 and 2017. In 2017 alone, 254,4467 were admitted for treatment in the north-east emergency states (Adamawa, Borno and Yobe). | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/01/2018
